page.title: 02Landscape in New Mills.
page.content: New Mills is on the border of North Derbyshire and is also on the edge of the Peak National Park. The town population is about 10.5 thousand.The two main groups of land cover are farmland and residential. The farmland is mainly rough grazing. We don't grow crops because the land is too hilly and high. We have a nature trail which is called the Sett Valley Trail and it is an old railway track. We have railways,good roads and also canals. The council financed a new plantation of 10,000 trees recently on an old refuse dump. We have also planted trees next to High Lea Park to replace an old and dying wood. The climate in New Mills is of high rainfall, and due to it's height above sea level, cold winters.
